Articles.Content:
Greetings.

Been a fan of KSP since the first demo I played, but never bothered to register before. I've dragged a few others into playing the game as well, several of whom are hooked on it now as well. Also seem to have broken the rule of "The first rocket must explode" because my first attempt reached Mun.

Quite interested in science and space technology, and often wonder why the heck everyone is so interested in new ways of killing each other and how to look better instead of useful things. Celebrities and movies need less attention, getting off Earth needs more, at least IMO. Quite interested in ideas such as the Orion Drive, and was exceptionally glad that nyrath made a mod to add it to KSP. (Yes, I am big on mods)

So more or less, I am a crazy tech-freak that thinks we are doing everything wrong. Anyone else similar?

The reason everyone else likes to make things like that is because once you figure the game out, you start to want to do that. Trust me, eventually you'll start building mass relays and military vehicles.

But hello and welcome!

Sorry, I meant in real life. Too much research into the wrong things in RL.

Ingame, I do lots of crazy things too, such as making "light probes" that are over 50 tons and can do everything except fix tires I still think we need a way to fix tires with smaller rovers so you could do a fully unmanned mission.
